title: This New Design Book Teaches You How to Decorate Your Home Like a Wes Anderson Film
description:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.

	Wes Ander
body:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.

	Wes Andersonâ€™s meticulously curated worlds are heading offscreen and into the home with â€œLive Like Wes,â€ a new interiors book that translates the filmmakerâ€™s signature visual language into practical design inspiration.

	Authored by writer Jessie Atkinson, â€œLive Like Wes: Home Decor Inspired by Wes Anderson Moviesâ€ pairs the directorâ€™s most beloved films with contemporary interior design aesthetics, offering readers a room-by-room guide to recreating Andersonâ€™s distinct blend of symmetry, color and nostalgia in real life. The hardcover coffee-table book hits shelves Jan. 13, published by Hachette Mobius.



						
			
	

	
					

	Each chapter anchors itself to a specific Anderson film â€” from a â€œFantastic Mr. Foxâ€-inspired cottagecore kitchen to â€œAsteroid Cityâ€-style Americana â€” and explores how its visual themes can be translated into livable interiors. Alongside style-focused film analysis, the book features photography from the homes of 25 interior designers. 

	Beyond dÃ©cor inspiration, â€œLive Like Wesâ€ also leans into experiential living. Each chapter includes an illustrated DIY craft project and a film-themed party plan, complete with playlists, dream guest lists and  cocktail recipes inspired by the auteur. Projects range from gallery walls and garlands to a skull-and-crossbones trinket box and knitted table favors.

	Atkinsonâ€™s newest release follows a slew of book and merch to come out in recent years, extending the filmmakerâ€™s obsessively curated aesthetic far beyond the screen. Titles like â€œThe Wes Anderson Collection seriesâ€ â€” from â€œThe Grand Budapest Hotelâ€ and â€œThe Royal Tenenbaumsâ€ to â€œIsle of Dogsâ€ â€” have become must-own coffee-table books for cinephiles, blending set photography with deep dives into production design. Meanwhile, design and lifestyle offshoots such as â€œThe Wes Anderson Cookbookâ€  have translated his visual language into recipes, room layouts and craft projects. Dozens of merch collaborations have also spun off from his theatrical releases â€” from Moleskine notebooks and stationary to collectible figures, and even hand-blown glass pipes.


	Purchase Atkinsonâ€™s newest design book here, and more Wes Anderson merch here.

schema.headline: This New Design Book Teaches You How to Decorate Your Home Like a Wes Anderson Film

title: Shay Mitchell-Founded Brand BÃ‰IS Taps Into Men's Market With New 'Performance-Driven' Luggage Collection
description:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.
	Shay Mitch
body:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.
	Shay Mitchellâ€˜s luggage brand BÃ‰IS â€” with its pastel-hued Weekender bags and innovative compartments for extensive wardrobes â€” has made a name for itself among female content creators since its launch in 2018. Now, the viral luggage brand is tapping into the menâ€™s market with its debut Pro Collection. The campaign even stars actor Tyriq Withers, just in time for his starring role in the book-to-screen adaptation of Colleen Hooverâ€™s â€œReminders of Him.

	  Each item of the collection is crafted from ultra-tough Ballistic Nylon, a new material for BÃ‰IS, and engineered for exceptional abrasion resistance and long-term durability. Designed with premium utility in mind, the luggage delivers smart organization and a minimalist, rugged aesthetic, representative of BÃ‰ISâ€™s strongest styles to date in a compact, highly functional lineup.Â The collection features five pieces in the colorways Flame, Khaki and Black.As part of the campaign, BÃ‰IS will also be taking the Pro Collection on the road to the Bay Area during Super Bowl weekend, Feb. 7-8. The brand will take over SF Brewing Co. & Restaurant for an open-to-the-public event on Saturday with games, product giveaways, and additional programming, followed by a watch party on Sunday. Â The Pro Collection will launch onÂ www.beistravel.comÂ on Jan. 21 with prices ranging from $68 to $438. Check out a few standout items from the collection below:
	A padded organizer that keeps camera bodies, lenses, and accessories safe and sorted with removable velcro dividers.

	A hands-free staple featuring a hidden back pocket for secure storage, a fleece-lined front pocket for tech or sunglasses, and interior dividers
	Lightweight with thoughtful organization, with a dedicated back tech compartment, various interior pockets, and a comfort-first design.
	Roll it or carry it, this versatile carry-on features stowaway wheels and backpack straps, with large interior pockets and a padded laptop sleeve.
	BÃ‰ISâ€™s first hybrid bag combines a rugged hardshell base to protect essentials with an expandable soft top for extra packing.Â

schema.headline: Shay Mitchell-Founded Brand BÃ‰IS Taps Into Men's Market With New 'Performance-Driven' Luggage Collection

title: J.J. Abramsâ€™ New Movie â€˜The Great Beyond,â€™ â€˜The Conjuring: First Communionâ€™ and More Set Release Dates
description:
J.J. Abramsâ€™ next movie is coming to Imax theaters this fall, Warner Bros. announced Friday.

	The film, starring Glen Powell and Jenna Ortega, is o
body:
J.J. Abramsâ€™ next movie is coming to Imax theaters this fall, Warner Bros. announced Friday.

	The film, starring Glen Powell and Jenna Ortega, is officially titled â€œThe Great Beyondâ€ and will launch into theaters on Nov. 13. Abrams wrote and directed the movie, which marks his return to big-screen blockbusters after helming 2019â€™s â€œStar Wars: Episode IX -The Rise of Skywalker.â€ He also produced the project alongside Tommy Gormley. Emma Mackey, Sophie Okonedo, Merritt Wever and Samuel L. Jackson round out the filmâ€™s starry ensemble cast.
	

	Warner Bros. also announced release dates for a couple of 2027 releases: Sam Esmailâ€™s â€œPanic Carefully,â€ starring Julia Roberts, will debut in Imax theaters on February 26, 2027; meanwhile, Tim Miller and Keanu Reevesâ€™ yet-to-be-titled team-up will premiere on August 13.


	â€œPanic Carefullyâ€ marks the latest collaboration between Esmail and Roberts, following their Prime Video series â€œHomecoming,â€ the Starz show â€œGaslitâ€ and the Netflix movie â€œLeave the World Behind.â€ Starring alongside Roberts are Eddie Redmayne, Brian Tyree Henry, Ben Chaplin, Aidan Gillen, Joe Alwyn, Naledi Murray and Elizabeth Olsen. Esmail and Roberts produced the new movie with Scott Stuber, Chad Hamilton, Marisa Yeres Gill and Lisa Gillan. 

	Details about Miller and Reevesâ€™ sci-fi film have been kept largely under wraps, but an early logline teased that the plot focuses on â€œa smuggler caught in a mysterious time loop must survive both bloodthirsty mercenaries and sharks in Caribbean waters, repeating the same deadly day until he finds a way out.â€ Miller directs from a script by Ian Shorr; Matthew Vaughn, Aaron Ryder, Andrew Swett and John Zaozirny are producing. 
	

	New Line Cinemaâ€™s next installment in â€œThe Conjuringâ€ franchise, â€œFirst Communion,â€ is dated for September 10. The prequel movie â€” directed by Rodrigue Huart from a screenplay by Richard Naing and Ian Goldberg â€” further expands the $2.7 billion-grossing â€œConjuringâ€ universe. The most recent film, â€œThe Conjuring Last Rites,â€ is the highest-grossing installment to date, earning nearly $495 million worldwide.

schema.headline: J.J. Abramsâ€™ New Movie â€˜The Great Beyond,â€™ â€˜The Conjuring: First Communionâ€™ and More Set Release Dates

title: Variety Awards Circuit Podcast Roundtable: Golden Globes Without Shocking Wins, Oscar Voting Uncertainty and Potential Best Picture Shakeups
description: Oscar voting is about to come to an end, and the question about which films and performances will dominate this yearâ€™s Academy Award nominations is
body:
Oscar voting is about to come to an end, and the question about which films and performances will dominate this yearâ€™s Academy Award nominations is still up in the air. The Variety Awards Circuit Podcast Roundtable team gathered to dissect the state of the race, how the Golden Globes results affected voting, and whether any snubs or surprises are lurking in the wings.

	After kicking off the conversation gushing about Apple TVâ€™s hit drama series â€œPluribusâ€ with Rhea Seehorn, we got into the night at the Globes. â€œOne Battle After Anotherâ€ led the night with four wins, including best picture (comedy or musical). At the same time, Chloe Zhaoâ€™s â€œHamnetâ€ took home a high-profile award for best picture (drama) and Ryan Cooglerâ€™s â€œSinnersâ€ walked away with the box office and cinematic achievement category.
	

	â€œI went 25 for 28, and it feels so anticlimactic,â€ Clayton Davis, chief awards editor, said. â€œYou could have been â€˜Joe Schmoâ€™ from the street and predict the globes and nail like 85 percent of them.â€


	The podcasters agreed that the only real shocks came from Michelle Williams winning for â€œDying for Sexâ€ on the TV side and Teyana Taylorâ€™s supporting actress victory for â€œOne Battle After Another.â€ And if those are considered surprises, we shouldnâ€™t be too hard on the group for following the appropriate tea leaves of the fall and winter awards season.

	In addition to delivering what the group agreed was the â€œspeech of the night,â€ Jenelle Riley, associate features editor, also called Taylor the â€œstar of the BAFTA tea party,â€ which took place the day before the Golden Globes.
	

	The group also analyzed how both female acting categories, have a potential for â€œfluidityâ€ between who makes the cut and who does not. Some of those discussed include Ariana Grandeâ€™s chances of a supporting actress nomination for â€œWicked: For Good,â€ and uncertainty about whether both Emma Stone and Kate Hudson could secure best actress nominations for â€œBugoniaâ€ and â€œSong Sung Blue.â€

	And there are the populist choices that could be lurking within the fray.

	Appleâ€™s high-stakes race car drama â€œF1â€ is feeling more like a best picture contender by the day. Jazz Tangcay, senior artisans editor, noted the filmâ€™s packed Q&A events and strong guild support, while Michael Schneider, executive TV editor, who has watched the film twice this year, praised it as â€œa classic sports movieâ€ with â€œall the beats that you want.â€

	Tangcay also noted that Autumn Durald Arkapawâ€™s cinematography on â€œSinnersâ€ seems like a slam-dunk for a nomination, calling it â€œby far the best of the yearâ€ and predicting the Filipino cinematographer will make history with her nomination. However, she does acknowledge that â€œTrain Dreamsâ€ by Brazilian Adolpho Veloso is a potential candidate for the win.

	The group also discussed potential surprises in makeup and hairstyling, such as the unibrow and acne-detailed â€œMarty Supremeâ€ and the potential for legendary musician Billy Joel to nab his first career nomination for his documentary â€œBilly Joel Should be Dead.â€

	Oscar nominations will be announced Jan. 22, with the ceremony scheduled for Mar. 15.

	Varietyâ€™s â€œAwards Circuitâ€ podcast, hosted by Clayton Davis, Jazz Tangcay, Emily Longeretta, Jenelle Riley and Michael Schneider, who also produces, is your one-stop source for lively conversations about the best in film and television. Each episode, â€œAwards Circuitâ€ features interviews with top film and TV talent and creatives, discussions and debates about awards races and industry headlines, and much more. Subscribe via Apple Podcasts, Stitcher, Spotify or anywhere you download podcasts.

schema.headline: Variety Awards Circuit Podcast Roundtable: Golden Globes Without Shocking Wins, Oscar Voting Uncertainty and Potential Best Picture Shakeups

title: â€˜The Traitorsâ€™: Michael Rapaport Claims Controversial Remark to Colton Underwood About Keeping a Secret Had â€˜Nothing to Do With His Sexualityâ€™
description: SPOILER ALERT: This story contains spoilers from â€œIf Youâ€™re Gonna Come for Me, Iâ€™ll Finish You,â€ the fifth episode of â€œThe Traitorsâ€ Season 4, now s
body:
SPOILER ALERT: This story contains spoilers from â€œIf Youâ€™re Gonna Come for Me, Iâ€™ll Finish You,â€ the fifth episode of â€œThe Traitorsâ€ Season 4, now streaming on Peacock.

	Michael Rapaport is under fire for his latest comments on â€œThe Traitors.â€ During the fifth episode of Season 4, which was released on Thursday night, the actor called out Colton Underwood during the roundtable.

	Earlier in the day, Underwood and Rapaport got into a yelling match as the former Bachelor claimed his opponent was a Traitor and tried to convince the rest of the cast that was the case. However, since Underwood had previously led the troops incorrectly when targeting â€œBig Brotherâ€ star Tiffany Mitchell, Rapaport claimed that in fact he was the traitor, trying to throw everyone off. Once at the roundtable, the argument boiled over.
	

	â€œI am angry, Iâ€™m pissed off, and I am isolated because of him, and nobody in this room would be better at holding a secret than you,â€ Rapaport said, to which Underwood responded, â€œThere it is.â€

	A quick backstory: Underwood appeared on â€œThe Bacheloretteâ€ and â€œThe Bachelor,â€ both showcasing his relationships with women. He spoke often (and wrote in his book) about being straight despite people questioning his sexuality throughout his life. In 2020, Cassie Randolph, who won his season of â€œThe Bachelor,â€ filed a restraining order against him for stalking and placing a tracker on her car, which he eventually admitted to. The following year, Underwood came out as gay.

	â€œYou think it was fun for 29 years of my life?â€ Underwood asked Rapaport while at the roundtable. Quickly, Rapaport said, â€œNo, no, no, that has nothing to do with this. I think you came into this game loving the idea of being a Traitor.â€
	

	Multiple other cast members then chimed in. Olympian Johnny Weir said, â€œYou canâ€™t blame somebody being forced intoa closet for the majority of their life,â€ to which Rapaport replied, â€œIâ€™m not talking about closetsâ€¦ His behavior is of a Traitor, his behavior is secret, itâ€™s connivingâ€¦ Itâ€™s cowardly.â€

	When â€œLove Islandâ€ star Maura Higgins called the remarks â€œa very low blow,â€ Rapaport replied, â€œI donâ€™t think it was, it wasnâ€™t intended to be,â€ before adding, â€œI apologize if he took it that way.â€ 

	While the point of the rountable is to banish Traitors, many members of the cast took this chance to oust Rapaport â€” and didnâ€™t care whether he was a Traitor or Faithful. â€œToday, the way you spoke to Colton, for me, itâ€™s enough to write your name down. So I think we should just get together and vote him out of here,â€ said â€œSurvivorâ€ star Natalie Anderson.

	With that, 11 out of 16 cast members voted to banish him. When revealing his name, Weir added, â€œI donâ€™t give a shit what you are. I just want you out of my castle.â€

	After his banishment, Rapaport apologized in his confessional. â€œIt sucks, but I felt backed into a corner, and I tried to fight my way out of it. Maybe I fought too hard. I meant what I meant within the context of the game. It had nothing to do with his sexuality,â€ he said. â€œI really sincerely apologize if I offended Colton or anybody in the house. That absolutely wasnâ€™t my intention.â€

	After the three-episode â€œTraitorsâ€ premiere on Jan. 8, the audience immediately seemed to hate Rapaport as one, and he continually took on fans on X. In response to one tweet making fun of him, he wrote, â€œThey/Them opinions donâ€™t mean sh*t. They Them ainâ€™t even real THEY or THEMS.â€ He ended up locking his account, going private on X, but has since unlocked it again.

	After the Jan. 15 episodes aired, he posted on X, â€œI played a hard game, I played a real game & I had a fun. Never wanted to offend anyone watching or the cast.â€ He has continued to tweet through it, arguing with those posting about him; on Friday, he replied to one â€œTraitorsâ€ viewer on X and mocked them for having pronouns in their bio. He also canceled his exit interviews that were scheduled for Friday.

schema.headline: â€˜The Traitorsâ€™: Michael Rapaport Claims Controversial Remark to Colton Underwood About Keeping a Secret Had â€˜Nothing to Do With His Sexualityâ€™

title: Jimmy Kimmel Says Donald Trump Can Take His Awards â€˜If You Agree to Pull ICE Out of Minneapolisâ€™
description:
Jimmy Kimmel has an offer that he thinks President Donald Trump is â€œgonna find difficult to refuse.â€

	Joking about Venezuelan opposition leader Mar
body:
Jimmy Kimmel has an offer that he thinks President Donald Trump is â€œgonna find difficult to refuse.â€

	Joking about Venezuelan opposition leader MarÃ­a Corina Machadoâ€™s White House visit on Thursday, during which she presented Trump with her Nobel Peace Prize, Kimmel proposed a way to one-up her.

	â€œIf and only if you agree to pull ICE out of Minneapolis and put them back at the borders where they belong, I am prepared to offer you one of the following trophies that I have been honored with over the years,â€ Kimmel said during his monologue on Thursday as his sidekick Guillermo Rodriguez wheeled out a cart full of trophies.
	

	â€œThe Daytime Emmy I won for best game show host in 1999: That could be yours,â€ Kimmel continued. â€œOr perhaps you would prefer my Clio Award for my work selling crap to people. Or my Webby Award, the most prestigious award the internet can give. Or my Writers Guild Award. This is a good one; you can see it looks nice.â€


	â€œOr best of all, Iâ€™m willing to hand over my 2015 Soul Train Award for White Person of the Year,â€ Kimmel concluded as the camera cut to a close-up of the placard. â€œThe choice is yours. I will personally deliver any or even all of these to the Oval Office in exchange for leaving the people of Minneapolis alone.â€

	Kimmel spent much of his monologue on Thursday focused on ICEâ€™s escalating presence in Minneapolis and Trump recent comments on it, including his threat to invoke the Insurrection Act. â€œThe Insurrection Act would allow President Trump to send troops to Minneapolis to stop the civil unrest that started when President Trump sent ICE into Minneapolis to start the civil unrest,â€ Kimmel said near the beginning of the episode. â€œI donâ€™t know, I guess you have to look at it from his perspective. Poor guy, he hasnâ€™t been able to get an insurrection for years.â€
	

	Kimmel is one of Trumpâ€™s most outspoken critics, perhaps even more so since the fall of 2025, when â€œJimmy Kimmel Liveâ€ was removed from the air temporarily due to the late night hostâ€™s comments about the killing of Charlie Kirk. The suspension incited nationwide conversations about censorship under the Trump administration.

schema.headline: Jimmy Kimmel Says Donald Trump Can Take His Awards â€˜If You Agree to Pull ICE Out of Minneapolisâ€™

title: â€˜Heated Rivalryâ€™ Fans Are Flocking to the Real-Life Ice Rink: â€˜We Want to Support It All We Canâ€™
description: If youâ€™re a fan of â€œHeated Rivalry,â€ you might just have Ontarioâ€™s Guelph Storm ice hockey team to thank. Last year, the team missed the playoffs, l
body:
If youâ€™re a fan of â€œHeated Rivalry,â€ you might just have Ontarioâ€™s Guelph Storm ice hockey team to thank. Last year, the team missed the playoffs, leaving their facility, the Sleeman Centre, unusually vacant.Â 

	â€œWe normally donâ€™t book anything into April and May,â€ said Ryan Giles, who manages the multi-purpose arena. â€œ[But] once they missed the playoffs, I had all this availability. We get inquiries all the time from different shows and films or commercials that are like, â€˜Hey, we need an arena for this,â€™ and we happened to be available. We actually had removed our ice for the season and then put it back in for the film shoot.â€Â 
	

	While it may have been a bummer for the team, it worked out well for the facility â€” the â€œHeated Rivalryâ€ cast and crew shot every hockey sequence at the facilityâ€™s rink over the course of just 10 days, transforming the 5,000-seat space into the fictional home of Shane Hollanderâ€™s Montreal Metros, Ilya Rozanovâ€™s Boston Raiders and Scott Hunterâ€™s New York Admirals. And while the MLH (the showâ€™s version of the NHL) might be fictitious, thatâ€™s not stopping dedicated fans of the series from venturing to the Sleeman Centre to see the rink for themselves.Â 


	Created by Jacob Tierney, â€œHeated Rivalryâ€ follows the relationship between closeted gay hockey players Shane and Ilya. To say itâ€™s taken the world by storm would be an understatement; since the showâ€™s premier on Nov. 28, 2025, the Crave original series has accumulated more than 600 million streaming minutes. It makes sense that fans are eager to see where the show was filmed: In the past six weeks, thereâ€™s definitely been an uptick in visitors who are â€œmore quick to snap their cameraâ€ and a â€œlittle more wide eyed around the spaceâ€ than the typical Guelph Storm spectator, said Giles.Â 
	

	At this point, he estimated heâ€™s seen hundreds of fans swing by to take selfies or purchase Sleeman Centre merchandise. However, since the hockey games tend to sell out (it is winter in Canada, after all), itâ€™s impossible to know how many onlookers might be in attendance solely to get a glimpse at where the show was shot. â€œThey could easily discreetly come in and we not notice with 5,000 people at a game,â€ said Giles.Â 

	One way he does know fans are visiting is from the facilityâ€™s social media mentions, which are in the thousands, he said. â€œWeâ€™ve seen the TikToks,â€ said Giles. â€œThereâ€™s a lot of them, of people that are just showing up and wanting to take pictures around the building.â€ Luckily for them, the rinkâ€™s team is happy to provide a quick tour, though devotees to the show probably wonâ€™t need one: â€œOnce you enter the space, you can see where they were,â€ said Giles. â€œIf youâ€™ve really watched the show, youâ€™re like, â€˜Oh, I know what this is and that is.â€™â€Â 

	The rinkâ€™s lower bowl is general admission, so anyone is able to purchase a ticket and enjoy a game if theyâ€™re interested in getting a closer look. The one spot thatâ€™s tricky to access is the suite level, which requires a VIP ticket (thatâ€™s where Shane and Ilya have their tense exchange at the Sochi Olympics). â€œWe have had a couple of individuals who did approach us and say, â€˜Hey, can I see the space?â€™ And with our staff, we were able to provide them with a quick tour and then take them back down to the general admission space,â€ said Giles.Â Â Â 

	Giles had no idea how popular the show would become (the extent of his knowledge pre-shooting was that it was a â€œhockey based productionâ€), but itâ€™s been exciting for him to see how itâ€™s sparking an interest in the sport from a new demographic. â€œThereâ€™s been so many individuals that generally donâ€™t follow hockey, or arenâ€™t interested in hockey, that this is exposing them to,â€ said Giles. The Sleeman Centre isnâ€™t the only place this is happening â€” interest in hockey tickets on StubHub increased 40% during â€œHeated Rivalryâ€™sâ€ run, the company reported earlier this month. Plus, amongst the typical â€œboys clubâ€ culture of the sport, the show is â€œopening doors,â€ said Giles. â€œItâ€™s pushing those boundaries to say, â€˜Itâ€™s 2026, letâ€™s all be inclusiveâ€™â€¦ We want to support it all we can.â€Â 
	

	The â€œHeated Rivalryâ€ effect isnâ€™t exclusive to the Sleeman Centre. Other filming locations like Relay Coffee Roasters, which stands in as the Straw+Berry smoothie shop in the third episode, have also seen a steady stream of fans coming to their cafe in Hamilton, Ont..Â 

	â€œThe response has been really fun,â€ said Rachel Hofing, who co-founded Relay Coffee Roasters with her husband, Jason. â€œPeople have been kind of making a plan to come see it, whereas they may not have heard of my cafe otherwiseâ€¦ Thereâ€™ve been quite a few people coming in and then posting about it, always with some little joke about the â€˜Blue Moon Over Brooklynâ€™ smoothie.â€Â Â 

	And while Relay Coffee doesnâ€™t actually offer smoothies, they are experimenting with ways to get a â€œHeated Rivalryâ€ drink on the menu â€” right now, theyâ€™re working on a banana brulee syrup and are hoping to add a banana blueberry coffee to their offerings (both nods to Scott and Kipsâ€™ relationship in the episode). The cafe is even set to host a sold-out fan meet up later this month.Â 

	Other filming locations in Ontario include Mansion Nightclub, the rooftop bar Lavelle, Le Tambour Tavern and Dundurn Castle, which acts as Moscow during Ilyaâ€™s jogging scenes, to name a few.Â 

	Naturally, speculation around Season 2 has already begun. But Giles isnâ€™t able to provide any insight into when that shooting might take place: â€œWe havenâ€™t heard from the production company for Season 2,â€ said Giles. â€œHowever, I could move a few things around if the opportunity came up.â€

schema.headline: â€˜Heated Rivalryâ€™ Fans Are Flocking to the Real-Life Ice Rink: â€˜We Want to Support It All We Canâ€™

title: Virginia Madsen on Her Personal Connection to Armed Forces PTSD Drama â€˜Sheepdogâ€™ and How it Helped Her Process Grief
description: The term Gold Star Family refers to the immediate family of a U.S. service member who died in the line of duty. Itâ€™s a term Oscar-nominated actor Vi
body:
The term Gold Star Family refers to the immediate family of a U.S. service member who died in the line of duty. Itâ€™s a term Oscar-nominated actor Virginia Madsen was all too familiar with even before she signed on to the film â€œSheepdog,â€ which hits theaters today.

	Written, directed, produced and starring Steven Grayhm, â€œSheepdogâ€ tells the story of Calvin Cole, an Army veteran battling with PTSD. He is helped on the road to recovery by his unlikely friendship with a recent parolee and Vietnam veteran (Vondie Curtis-Hall) and Dr. Elecia Knox (Madsen), a VA trauma therapist-in-training.
	

	Her nephew, Hudson, was a young serviceman who died from a self-inflicted gunshot wound in 2022. Hudsonâ€™s father was actor Michael Madsen, who passed away last year. Madsen recalls how she struggled to help her family upon Hudsonâ€™s passing. â€œYou have this feeling of, â€˜What can I do? How do we help each other?â€™â€


	Not long after, she received the script for â€œSheepdog,â€ and the story resonated with her, particularly as Calvin is a young soldier. While she says she was â€œblown away by the beautyâ€ of the script, she still wanted to clear it with her family. â€œI needed to go to them individually and ask for their blessing,â€ she reveals. â€œI told them, â€˜I think this is right. I think this is a way that I can honor him. I think theyâ€™re talking about it in the right way.â€™â€ It helped knowing Grayhm had spent 10 years talking to veterans and their families to get the script right. There were also 17 military veterans and five Gold Star family members working on the set and in post-production of the film.
	

	While shooting the film was a great experience, Madsen also knows that â€œonce my job is done, you donâ€™t know what theyâ€™re going to do with it.â€ So when she was finally able to see â€œSheepdog,â€ she was overwhelmed. â€œIt was so incredible,â€ she recalls. â€œThey did it right, and it affected me on such a deep, personal level.â€ That feeling only increased when she began to travel with the film to festivals and attend screenings with Gold Star families.

	Speaking with so many people â€” both in preparing for the film and after screening it â€” has been deeply moving. Itâ€™s also been rewarding to open conversations about PTSD, a term that might initially â€œmake people squeamish to hear.â€ Says Madsen, â€œWe all know the term Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder, but I learned a new term, which is Post-Traumatic Growth. Recovery can lead to growth, and people need to know the helpers are out there. I wanted to see the good side of this story and show that itâ€™s possible.â€

	Though the film deals with serious subject matter, it is ultimately hopeful. In addition, war is never shown on screen. And the audiences have been appreciative: â€œYou meet so many people who say, â€˜This is our voice. You heard us. Nobody is talking about these things.â€™â€



	

									Allen Media Group Motion Pictures
	



	Playing Dr. Knox has also helped Madsen in her own life as she learned more about how therapists help process grief with such methods as EMDR, a process depicted in the film. â€œThis experience and being able to talk to other people has really helped ground me,â€ she says, adding that it was helpful when her brother passed away. â€œIâ€™m not saying that I didnâ€™t fall apart because I really did, but I had some tools, and I was able to speak to others about it and be supportive. It helped me feel I wasnâ€™t alone in all of this.â€

	Several of the family members she sought permission from have also seen the film and have been very supportive. â€œI was open about how I was going to be talking about the film and wanted to be able to name him, so I checked in with them again,â€ she says. â€œMost people know someone who has been through something like this, and I hope it leads to more conversation and people connecting with one another because we are losing a lot of human interaction behind our screens. And the smallest gestures can matter.â€
	

	To that end, Madsen recalls asking a veteran how he really felt when people say, â€œThank you for your service.â€ She reveals, â€œHe said, â€˜If there is meaning behind those words, it feels really good.â€™ If you mean it and you give someone that moment, you could make someoneâ€™s day.â€

schema.headline: Virginia Madsen on Her Personal Connection to Armed Forces PTSD Drama â€˜Sheepdogâ€™ and How it Helped Her Process Grief

title: â€˜Brooklyn Nine-Nineâ€™ Duo Scores NBC Pilot Order for Detective Comedy
description: â€œBrooklyn Nine-Nineâ€ co-creator Dan Goor and executive producer Luke Del Tredici have secured a pilot order from NBC for an untitled detective comed
body:
â€œBrooklyn Nine-Nineâ€ co-creator Dan Goor and executive producer Luke Del Tredici have secured a pilot order from NBC for an untitled detective comedy.

	Per the cheeky logline, the project â€œcontinues the proud tradition of Los Angeles private eyes that began with Philip Marlowe and will end with this show.â€

	The pilot will be executive produced by Goor and Del Tredici, and the studio is Universal Television, a division of Universal Studio Group. No additional details about the pilot, including who might be cast in it, were revealed. 
	

	This is one of many pilots ordered by NBC in the past week. On Thursday, the network announced a drama pilot from Dean Georgaris and John Fox, inspired by the real-life FBI research of Dr. Ann Burgess. Earlier this week, the network announced a drama pilot order from Josh Safran, Jenna Bush Hager and Ben Spector called â€œProtection,â€ about a family of law enforcement agents becoming the target of a mysterious assassin. Plus, NBC gave a pilot order to a â€œcontemporary updateâ€ on â€œThe Rockford Filesâ€ from Mike Daniels (â€œSons of Anarchyâ€).


	The network also announced a comedy series in development called â€œLast Chance Lawyer,â€ starring Henry Winkler as an unorthodox criminal defense attorney who is a fierce advocate for his underdog clients, believing, according to the logline, â€œthat no matter what they are accused of, the system is always guiltier.â€

	Also on the NBCUniversal comedy front is â€œDig,â€ a series from Michael Schur (â€œThe Office,â€ â€œParks and Recreationâ€) and Amy Poehler about four archaeologists who are pulled into an international conspiracy. That show is set to debut on Peacock.

schema.headline: â€˜Brooklyn Nine-Nineâ€™ Duo Scores NBC Pilot Order for Detective Comedy

title: â€˜God of Warâ€™ Live-Action Series Casts Teresa Palmer
description:
Teresa Palmer has been cast in the â€œGod of Warâ€ series adaptation at Amazon Prime Video, Variety has confirmed with sources.

	Palmer is the latest
body:
Teresa Palmer has been cast in the â€œGod of Warâ€ series adaptation at Amazon Prime Video, Variety has confirmed with sources.

	Palmer is the latest cast member on the show, following the announcement that Ryan Hurst will star as Kratos. Amazon did not immediately respond to Varietyâ€˜s request for comment on Palmerâ€™s casting, but sources say she will star as Sif. In the games, Sif is the wife of Thor and one of the chief Aesir. Interestingly, Hurst voiced Thor in the game â€œGod of War: Ragnarok.â€
	

	Palmer is primarily known for her work in film, having starred in features like â€œThe Fall Guy,â€ â€œHacksaw Ridge,â€ â€œThe Grudge 2,â€ â€œI Am Number Four,â€ and â€œKnight of Cups.â€ In television, she has been in shows such as â€œA Discovery of Witches,â€ â€œThe Clearing,â€ and â€œMix Tape.â€ She will next be seen in the Australian series â€œThe Family Next Door.â€ 


	Palmer is repped by CAA, Management 360, Shanahan Management in Austalia, and Sloane Offer. 

	As previously reported, the series will pick up with the story of the two most recent â€œGod of Warâ€ games, in which Kratos must raise his ten-year old son Atreus. Per the logline, â€œFather and son Kratos and Atreus embark on a journey to spread the ashes of their wife and mother, Faye. Through their adventures, Kratos tries to teach his son to be a better god, while Atreus tries to teach his father how to be a better human.â€

	Amazonâ€™s adaptation of â€œGod of Warâ€ has had a long road to the screen already. The show was originally greenlit at the streaming arm of the e-commerce giant back in 2022. Original showrunner Rafe Judkins exited the show in October 2024, with Ronald D. Moore joining as the new showrunner not long after.
	

	Moore is the writer, executive producer, and showrunner on â€œGod of Warâ€ under his Tall Ship Productions banner. Frederick E.O. Toye will direct the first two episodes. Maril Davis of Tall Ship also executive produces alongside Cory Barlog, Naren Shankar, Matthew Graham, Asad Qizilbash, Jeff Ketcham, Hermen Hulst, Roy Lee, and Brad Van Arragon. Joe Menosky, Marc Bernardin, Tania Lotia, and Ben McGinnis serve as co-executive producers on the series. The series is co-produced by Sony Pictures Television and Amazon MGM Studios in association with PlayStation Productions and Tall Ship Productions. Tall Ship is under an overall deal at Sony TV.

	Deadline first reported Palmerâ€™s casting.

schema.headline: â€˜God of Warâ€™ Live-Action Series Casts Teresa Palmer

title: Israeli Air Force Helicopter Crashes During Failed Airlift, Video Shows
description:
Israeli Air Force
                          Watch Black Hawk Helicopter Crash
body:
Israeli Air Force
                          Watch Black Hawk Helicopter Crash
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              January 16, 2026
                            9:05 AM PST
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          Looks like the Israeli Air Force is down a Black Hawk helicopter ... because one of their choppers fell from the sky and crashed while being airlifted ... and it's all on video.
      
    
          Footage shows another, larger helicopter towing an IAF UH-60 Black Hawk helicopter through the air when the harnesses appear to suddenly fail ... sending the Black Hawk into a nosedive before it crashes to the ground.
      
    
      
      WATCH: Israeli helicopter crashes while it was being airlifted. pic.twitter.com/3EISe6ONmJâ€” Clash Report (@clashreport) January 16, 2026
              @clashreport
          
  

          The incident reportedly happened Friday morning near a residential area in Gush Etzion -- outside Jerusalem -- but the Israel Defense Forces says there were no casualties.
      
    
          Unclear what caused the towing harnesses to fail ... Israel Air Force commander Maj.-Gen. Tomer Bar has ordered an investigation.
      
    
      
      WILD FOOTAGE ğŸ”´Fresh video shows a damaged Israeli Air Force UH 60 Black Hawk going down during transport near Gush Etzion (close to Jerusalem) pic.twitter.com/abJ4L3M398â€” Open Source Intel (@Osint613) January 16, 2026
              @Osint613
          
  
    
          The helicopter was being towed after making an emergency landing Tuesday ... sounds like it's been a rough week for this particular Black Hawk.
      
      
              
            
              Related articles
            
        
              
          
                          
                Plane Crash

title: Border Patrol Agent Knees Man in Head, Face During Minneapolis Arrest, on Video
description:
Minneapolis
                          Agent Repeatedly Knees Man in Face During Arrest
body:
Minneapolis
                          Agent Repeatedly Knees Man in Face During Arrest
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              January 16, 2026
                            10:33 AM PST
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          As Customs and Border Protection officers swarm a man to arrest him in Minnesota, one agent repeatedly knees him in the head and face ... and it's all on video.
      
    
          Footage out of Minneapolis shows a scrum of Border Patrol agents detaining a man in the middle of a busy street, piling on top of him ... and at one point during the struggle, one agent is seen smashing his knee into the guy's face. Another of the agents appears to notice they're on camera, and seems to check his colleague, who delivers a last blow to the man's forehead.
      

          They eventually pick the guy up and haul him away ... and it sounds like his name is Ricardo. Unclear what he was arrested for, but it looks like he was driving a car when he got ambushed by masked federal agents.
      
    
        
                    
                  
      
    
          The incident went down Jan. 9 ... just 2 days after an ICE agent shot and killed Renee Good in Minneapolis. A new report out today says Renee was shot 4 times.
      
    
          We've reached out to DHS ... so far, no word back.
      
      
              
            
              Related articles
